revised_title: The Impact of Gamma Irradiation on Cell Division in Tissue Culture
tldr: This study investigates the effects of gamma radiation on cell division in tissue cultures. The researchers found that gamma rays reduce the number of cells in mitosis, with the effect becoming noticeable after a certain threshold of exposure time and intensity. The study also found that the action of gamma rays is not purely cumulative, and there is a minimum threshold of intensity below which a given biological effect will not occur, regardless of exposure time.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
